pages.text: The feathered Alpine Dragon can often be found in small groups in high-altitude mountainous terrain. Despite their large size, they seem perfectly comfortable with the thinner air of their high-altitude habitat.

pages.title: Behavior
pages.text: Despite being found in groups, the creatures don't seem to exhibit much pack-oriented behavior, and generally won't step in if another member is in danger. When interacting with the beasts, I've found that they rarely attack unless provoked, however a wind blast created by their large and powerful wings can send an unwary traveller tumbling from a cliff side.

pages.title: Taming
pages.text: I've found that Alpine Dragons seem to have quite a fondness for honey, although sharing what I had wasn't sufficient to fully gain the creatures' trust. However, I have also noticed that the beasts will seek out and consume bees, and curiously enough, will allow them to leave the hive, only to consume them upon their return. Perhaps a bee might be a sufficient offering...
